explanation:
- OS_TranslatePath: Direct callee of OS_rmdir; must be inspected to see if it calls OS_rmdir (directly) or calls other functions that eventually call OS_rmdir (indirect recursion).
- OS_DirRemove_Impl: Direct callee that performs the actual removal; must be inspected for any direct or indirect call back to OS_rmdir.
- OS_printf: Called by OS_TranslatePath (per static graph). Utility/logging functions sometimes call higher-level routines in some builds; include to ensure no path back to OS_rmdir.
- OS_strnlen: Called by OS_TranslatePath; include because library/utility helpers could be wrappers that call into other OS_ functions that might reach OS_rmdir.
- OS_ObjectIdGetBySearch: Called by OS_TranslatePath; object-lookup functions may call other OS_ APIs (potentially including filesystem operations) that could reach OS_rmdir.
- OS_ObjectIndexFromToken: Called by OS_TranslatePath; include for the same reason as object-id helpers (they may call other OS_ APIs).
- OS_ObjectIdRelease: Called by OS_TranslatePath; include because it may call other OS_ APIs that could form an indirect recursion.
- UT_Stub_RegisterReturnType: Appears as a callee in the static graph for OS_rmdir/OS_TranslatePath; the unit-test stub framework can install handlers that may invoke OS APIs including OS_rmdir, so include to account for test-harness-induced indirect calls.
- UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData: As above, part of the UT stub infrastructure that can route calls/handlers; include to determine if stub machinery can produce an indirect call to OS_rmdir.
- UT_ExecuteBasicHandler: Part of the UT stub dispatch path; include because installed handlers can call back into OS APIs, possibly creating indirect recursion.
- UT_Stub_GetReturnValuePtr: Part of the UT stub API reachable from OS_rmdir/OS_TranslatePath; include because the stub machinery may invoke user handlers that could call OS_rmdir.

Note: The two direct callees (OS_TranslatePath and OS_DirRemove_Impl) are mandatory. The remaining symbols are the immediate callees of OS_TranslatePath (and the UT stub helpers present in the static graph) and are required to determine whether any transitive call chain can reach OS_rmdir, thereby violating the MISRA rule against direct or indirect self-calls.
